channel.title: Street-Bike Requirments In Ohio
channel.description:
Hey I've been looking for a simple answer for almost an hour now and all the websites I've looked at either don't give me a direct answer or contradict another website. I finally saved enough money for a 2010-Kawasaki-EX250-Ninja street bike but I was looking for the requirements to ride one legally on a road. I'm 17, have a drivers license, and live in north eastern Ohio. Do I need any additional permits?
If anyone from Ohio with knowledge of street bikes could give me an answer id appreciate it.

item.title: Street-Bike Requirments In Ohio
item.dc:creator: @Vix Vix
item.description:
@Vix wrote:

Thanks, just want to work out any details before I drop 2000 dollars.

Read full topic

item.title: Street-Bike Requirments In Ohio
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Vix:

Just to clarify the test is like getting your temps and i have one year to ride alone under some restrictions if I pass? I looked at that website a few times but another I saw contradicted it and said only a drivers license is required which threw me off.

Which Ohio Motorcycle License is Right for You?
[hr]
The Ohio BMV offers several different types of motorcycle licenses:

• A TIPIC (Temporary Instruction Permit Identification Card), for riders from ages 15½ to under 18.
• A License is a restricted driver’s license, which authorizes the holder to operate motorcycles only.
• A Motorcycle Endorsement is an add-on permit issued to persons who already hold a current, valid Ohio driver license. It authorizes the holder to operate motorcycles in addition to other types of vehicles.

Read full topic
